p: Rosemary is a dense bush, branched, evergreen and blue–white flower, reaching a height of about 1 m [ 39, 40]. It is characterized by leaves with 1–4 cm long and 2–4 mm wide, sessile, leathery, linear to linear-lanceolate, with curved edges, dark green upper side and granulosa and page bottom tomentous, with prominent midrib, and very characteristic smell [ 38, 40–41].
